title: Europe's failure to act on captured Isil fighters is creating even greater challenges
text:
Turkey’s military invasion of northern Syria raises some serious questions about the future status of up to 90,000 captives affiliated with Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (Isil) who are currently being held by Kurdish-led forces.

The principal objective of the Turkish offensive, which has been dubbed “Operation Peace Spring” by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, is to clear Kurdish fighters from their bases along the Syrian border with Turkey.

Relations between Ankara and Kurdish separatist groups in northern Syria have been strained for decades, and Mr Erdogan believes that, by establishing what he terms a “safe zone” in northern Syria, he can strengthen Turkey’s defences against...
description: Turkey’s military invasion of northern Syria raises some serious questions about the future status of up to 90,000 captives affiliated with Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (Isil) who are currently being held by Kurdish-led forces.
